claim: Conan the Barbarian hypothetically lasts a short time inside of Call of Duty.

supporting.text: Conan the Barbarian lacks modern combat training, making him ineffective against trained soldiers in Call of Duty.

attacks.text: Conan the Barbarian lacks modern combat training, making him ineffective against trained soldiers in Call of Duty.
Conan's exceptional physical strength and combat instincts could compensate for his lack of modern training, allowing him to adapt quickly.
Modern combat relies heavily on firearms and tactics, which Conan has no experience with, limiting his ability to adapt effectively.
Call of Duty often features close-quarters combat, where Conan's melee skills would give him an advantage.
Even in close-quarters, modern soldiers are trained in hand-to-hand combat and would likely outmaneuver Conan due to superior techniques.

supporting.text: Call of Duty's reliance on firearms and technology puts Conan at a severe disadvantage due to his melee-focused combat style.

attacks.text: Call of Duty's reliance on firearms and technology puts Conan at a severe disadvantage due to his melee-focused combat style.
Conan's exceptional physical strength and combat instincts could allow him to close the distance and neutralize opponents before they can effectively use firearms.
Modern firearms in Call of Duty have high accuracy and rate of fire, making it nearly impossible for Conan to close the gap without being shot.
Conan's experience in surviving against overwhelming odds in his own world suggests he could adapt to the unfamiliar technology of Call of Duty.
Adaptation takes time, and Call of Duty's fast-paced combat would not allow Conan the opportunity to learn or adjust before being eliminated.

supporting.text: The fast-paced, team-based gameplay of Call of Duty requires coordination and tactics that Conan's solo warrior approach cannot match.

attacks.text: The fast-paced, team-based gameplay of Call of Duty requires coordination and tactics that Conan's solo warrior approach cannot match.
Conan's exceptional combat skills and adaptability could allow him to quickly learn and dominate in Call of Duty's chaotic environment.
Call of Duty's reliance on modern weaponry and technology would render Conan's melee-focused combat style ineffective.
Conan's lack of familiarity with modern military tactics and communication would isolate him from team coordination.
Historical warriors have adapted to new combat environments before, suggesting Conan could learn quickly.

supporting.text: Conan's lack of familiarity with modern military tactics and equipment would lead to quick elimination in a Call of Duty scenario.

attacks.text: Conan's lack of familiarity with modern military tactics and equipment would lead to quick elimination in a Call of Duty scenario.
Conan's exceptional combat instincts and physical prowess could compensate for his unfamiliarity with modern tactics.
Modern military tactics and equipment are designed to neutralize even highly skilled individuals without specialized training.
Call of Duty scenarios often involve chaotic environments where raw combat ability can be more valuable than tactical knowledge.
Chaotic environments in Call of Duty still heavily favor those with knowledge of weapon handling and team coordination.

supporting.text: The health and armor systems in Call of Duty are designed for bullet-based combat, not melee, further reducing Conan's survivability.

attacks.text: The health and armor systems in Call of Duty are designed for bullet-based combat, not melee, further reducing Conan's survivability.
Conan's exceptional physical strength and combat skills could allow him to quickly eliminate enemies before they can react, bypassing the need for armor.
Call of Duty's fast-paced combat and ranged weaponry would overwhelm Conan before he could close the distance, regardless of his melee prowess.
Conan's durability and endurance, as depicted in his lore, might allow him to withstand some gunfire despite the armor system not being designed for melee.
Modern firearms in Call of Duty are highly lethal, and Conan's lack of familiarity with them would make him vulnerable even if he could endure some hits.
